intro: Millotia robusta, commonly known as the robust millotia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its sturdy, woody stems and large, palmate leaves. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of yellow and orange, which bloom in the summer months. Millotia robusta is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
